newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Coca-Cola Amatil gains on Manila deal.
newsitem.headline: Coca-Cola Amatil gains on Manila deal.

text.p: Australian-based softdrink bottler Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd pushed through the A$15 barrier on Thursday for the first time since last August.
C-C Amatil closed up 47.7 cents, or 3.2 percent, at A$15.20.
The stock has gained 86 cents, or 6.0 percent, since its close last Friday as investors continue to assess the link with San Miguel Corp of the Philippines announced early this month, dealers said.
"It's really on the back of the Philippine acquisition, I think that's all that's driving the stock at the moment," a senior dealer said.
San Miguel last Wednesday won shareholder approval for the deal under which C-C Amatil will acquire its majority-owned soft-drink subsidiary in exchange for a 25 percent shareholding in C-C Amatil.

A Sydney-based analyst said C-C Amatil was likely to trade around current levels until the release of an independent report on the agreement by Grant Samuel & Associates, due to be sent to shareholders on May 20.
"People will want to see what the effect of the acquisition is on C-C Amatil's numbers and what the growth of the industry is like over there (in the Philippines)," the analyst said.
"(The share price) will bounce around a bit...people are still a bit wary," he added.
C-C Amatil has scheduled an extraordinary general meeting in Sydney for June 12 to approve the San Miguel deal.
The company is 33 percent-owned by The Coca-Cola Co.
